newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: India tenders to buy June to October gasoline.
newsitem.headline: India tenders to buy June to October gasoline.

text.p: State-owned Indian Oil Corp (IOC) has re-emerged in the spot market to buy leaded gasoline for June and to buy test cargoes of unleaded gasoline for July to October through two tenders, industry sources said on Friday.
IOC, absent from the spot gasoline market since March, has issued the first tender to buy 25,000 tonnes of 87-octane with a lead content of 0.15 grammes per litre for delivery between June 10-14.
The tender closes May 28 at 0800 GMT and is valid May 29 2200 GMT.
Traders said the requirement was due to normal shortfalls in IOC's system while the second tender which sought unleaded 87-octane gasoline, was for testing the evnvironmental-friendly new grade.
The second which requires delivery in drums, is asking for 16 kilolitres (100 barrels) on unleaded gasoline for delivery in July, and 32 kilolitres for delivery each in August, September and October.
The four-month term tender closes June 3 at 2000 GMT and is valid until June 6 at 2200 GMT.
